page.title: 01General Information
page.content: Today only coppices of deciduous wood remind us that this was Wentwood Forest.The Forestry Commission manages the plantations of conifers. Grassland for cattle and dairy farming are important.There is a stud farm, egg production, market garden and a plant-hire firm. There are two villages - Catbrook and Trellech Grange. Each has a pub and a church. Trellech Grange takes its name from the grange or farm established by the Cistercian monks. Catbrook has a village hall a post office and a school. Many cottages have been renovated, there are council houses and housing built in the 70's. Recreation activities are fox hunting football,W.I. and shooting. Tourist accommodation and activities are available.
